clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Special Drug Use Investigation of Mepolizumab
clinical_study.official_title: NucalaÂ® Subcutaneous Injection Special Drug Use Investigation (Long-Term)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a special drug use investigation program of NUCALA (a brand name for Mepolizumab) administered subcutaneously (SC). In this study the information regarding the safety and effectiveness of long term use of NUCALA after subcutaneous injection will be collected from Asthma subjects in daily clinical practice. The observation period per subject will be 52 weeks from the initiation of NUCALA treatment with follow-up investigation for 2 years after the observation period. NUCALA is a registered trademark of the GlaxoSmithKline [GSK] group of companies

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects whose data enetered on Electronic data capture (EDC) system
primary_outcome.description: This includes the number of enrolled subjects whose data is entered in the EDC system.
It will be calculated as the number of subjects having adverse drug reaction by total number of subjects on NUCALA treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects showing Response to the treatment
primary_outcome.description: Response rate will be calculated as number of subjects showing response to the NUCALA treatment by total number of subjects on treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects excluded from analysis due to exacerbation of asthma
primary_outcome.description: Exacerbation of asthma includes, hospitalization, emergency room visit and usage of systemic steroids

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects having adverse drug reactions (ADR)
primary_outcome.description: ADR is defined as , a response to a drug which is noxious and unintended, and which occurs at doses normally used in man for the prophylaxis, diagnosis, or therapy of disease, or for the modifications of physiological function.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects require priority investigation matter
primary_outcome.description: Priority investigation matters include, Hypersensitivity reaction including anaphylaxis, infections, malignant tumour

secondary_outcome.measure: Response rate assessed by global assessment of effectiveness
secondary_outcome.description: The response rate is the proportion of subjects assessed as "effective" based on the course of subjective symptoms, and course of clinical symptoms
Frequency will be analyzed 52 weeks prior to the initiation of NUCALA treatment. Exacerbation of asthma includes, hospitalization, emergency room visit and usage of systemic steroids

secondary_outcome.measure: Total score of Asthma Control Test (ACT)
secondary_outcome.description: Information on ACT will be recorded by subjects before the initiation of the therapy and at Week 12, Week 24 and Week 52 after administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects having normal Peak Expiratory Flow (PEF) score
secondary_outcome.description: PEF is the Respiratory Function Test. It will be measured (at morning or evening) at the nearest time point of 1 week before and after the initiation of NUCALA treatment

arm_group.description: Subjects with a refractory asthma whose symptoms are inadequately controlled despite receiving standard asthma medications will be enrolled

intervention.description: Single dose of NUCALA SC will be administered. Dose unit, daily dose frequency, date of administration will be at the investigator discretion.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects receiving NUCALA for the first time for treatment of bronchial asthma (a refractory asthma whose symptoms are inadequately controlled despite receiving standard asthma medications)
